articles.author: Preethi Selvam
articles.description:
The Media Queries Level 4 specification has introduced a new syntax for targeting a range of viewport widths using common mathematical comparison operators, like , and =, that make more sense syntactically while writing less code for responsive web design.
The New CSS Media Query Range Syntax originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.

articles.description: We’ve spent the last two articles in this three-part series playing with gradients to make really neat image decorations using nothing but the element. sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (William Lyon)
articles.description: If building a GraphQL API backed by a native graph database sounds interesting or at all helpful for the problems you’re trying to solve as a developer, perhaps you’d like to give the open-source [Neo4j GraphQL Library](https://srv.buysellads.com/ads/long/x/TCZPLYDDTTTTTTFR6JINCTTTTTTGVUIVKKTTTTTTCT2NTYYTTTTTTI4BVH7U4JBCKQ466IDGV2IUWESGCV7WALL5QYYE) a try. Let’s take a closer look at the reasons why!
articles.title: Putting The Graph In GraphQL With The Neo4j GraphQL Library

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: November is just around the corner, and with it, a new collection of desktop wallpapers to celebrate the beginning of the month. Designed by creatives from all across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar. Let’s make November colorful!
articles.title: On The Edge Of November (2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yaphi Berhanu)
articles.description: If you've ever wanted to build a web app that you can control with hand gestures as if by magic, this article is for you. With a couple of APIs and some JavaScript, you can build apps that behave like sorcery.
articles.title: Motion Controls In The Browser

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alma Hoffmann)
articles.description: In this article, Alma Hoffmann discusses six basic variables to establish a typographic hierarchy, explains how to look at each differently, and in turn, designs pieces by intentionally modifying each variable to create a typographic hierarchy effectively.
articles.title: Typographic Hierarchies

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lea Verou)
articles.description: The annual survey for anyone who writes CSS, [State of CSS](https://stateofcss.com/en-us/?source=smashing_magazine_css_survey), is nearing the end of its response period for 2022. The survey is available in many different languages and all questions are optional.
articles.title: State Of CSS Survey: Influence The Future Of CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sacha Greif)
articles.description: In this article, Sacha Greif tries to anticipate future CSS trends and takes a look at some far-fetched and futuristic CSS features that might one day make their way to the browser.
articles.title: Futuristic CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)
articles.description: In this article, Patrick Brosset gives an update on the most impactful new features that are now available in DevTools, across Firefox, Chrome, Safari, and Edge.
articles.title: What’s New In DevTools: Halloween Edition 🎃

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Meet Understanding Privacy, our brand new Smashing Book to make sense of privacy, and learn how to create inclusive, safe and privacy-aware digital experiences. eBook now available, print shipping in November.
articles.title: Understanding Privacy: A New Smashing Book Is Here

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Schäferhoff)
articles.description: In this article, Nick Schäferhoff will take a deep dive into WordPress Full-Site Editing, examine the tools it provides for theme development, and provide a tutorial on how to use it to make changes to your site.
articles.title: WordPress Full-Site Editing: A Deep Dive Into The New Feature

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrii Zhdan)
articles.description: In this article about conducting productive meetings, Andrii Zhdan will give you a step-by-step guide on preparing a solid meeting structure that will let you follow the original plan and reach the meeting goals, and he will also share a few tips based on his design experience.
articles.title: Effective Communication For Everyday Meetings

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: Climate change and sustainability are increasing concerns for digital organizations, as well as individuals working in tech. In this article, we’ll explore some of the ways we can raise awareness and effect change within an organization to create a more positive environmental impact.
articles.title: Sustainable Web Development Strategies Within An Organization

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: In this article, Adrian Bece will show how to create same-document page transitions for Single Page Apps using Shared Element Transitions API and check out its future implementation and potential for creating cross-document transitions in Multi-Page Apps.
articles.title: Delightful UI Animations With Shared Element Transitions API (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Devansh Bansal)
articles.description: Owing to tremendous advancements in Machine Learning and other technologies, chatbots have increased in popularity in the past few years. This article will show you, step by step, how to build a chatbot that meets your business goals.
articles.title: A Roadmap For Building A Business Chatbot

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexander Godwin)
articles.description: Integrate two-factor authentication into your Express.js app by building an application that authenticates users using password-based authentication and OTPs powered by the Twilio Verify service.
articles.title: Node.js Authentication With Twilio Verify

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Brecht De Ruyte)
articles.description: We can use the `clamp()` method today because of the great browser support. In this article, Brecht De Ruyte explains how it can be a beautiful addition to your upcoming project or as an upgrade to a previous one.
articles.title: Easy Fluid Typography With clamp() Using Sass Functions

articles.author: Dillion Megida
articles.description: Event Delegation is a pattern based upon the concept of Event Bubbling [/news/event-bubbling-in-javascript/]. It is an event-handling pattern that allows you to handle events at a higher level in the DOM tree other than the level where the event was first received. There's a video version of this topic [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aZ3JWv0ofuA]
articles.title: Event Delegation in JavaScript –Explained with an Example

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Full stack development is a term used to describe the process of developing a complete website or application from start to finish. A full stack developer is a web developer who can work on all parts of a website or application, from the back-end code that powers the site to
articles.title: Learn Full Stack Development – HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, MongoDB

articles.author: P S Mohammed Ali
articles.description: > “It’s hard enough to find an error in your code when you’re looking for it; it’s even harder when you’ve assumed your code is error-free.” ― Steve McConnell Errors are inevitable in a programmer's life. In fact, while writing programs, errors can be really helpful in identifying the logic
articles.title: How to Handle Errors in Python – the try, except, else, and finally Keywords Explained

articles.author: Dillion Megida
articles.description: HTML elements receive different types of events, from click, to blur, to scroll, and so on. One behavior these events have in common is Event Bubbling. I'll explain what this behavior means in this article. I also made a video version of this article which you can watch here [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KaHZdW02Tg0].
articles.title: Event Bubbling in JavaScript – How Event Propagation Works with Examples

articles.author: Kolade Chris
articles.description: The Python error "TypeError: 'int' object is not subscriptable" occurs when you try to treat an integer like a subscriptable object. In Python, a subscriptable object is one you can “subscript” or iterate over. Why the "TypeError: 'int' object is not subscriptable Error" Occurs You can iterate over a string,
articles.title: TypeError: 'int' object is not subscriptable [Solved Python Error]

articles.author: Kayode Adeniyi
articles.description: Infrastructure as code is the process of provisioning and managing your cloud resources by writing a template file that is both human-readable and machine consumable.  For AWS cloud development, the built-in choice for infrastructure as code is AWS CloudFormation. Using IaC, developers can manage a project’s infrastructure efficiently, allowing
articles.title: How to Implement Infrastructure as Code with AWS

articles.author: Keyur Paralkar
articles.description: In this tutorial, you are going to learn what a proxy object is, along with its limitations. We will also look into some of the use cases that demonstrate how you can use proxy objects to solve various problems. Without further ado, let’s get started. Table of Contents  *
articles.title: How JavaScript's Proxy Object Works – Explained with Example Use Cases

articles.author: Edeh Israel Chidera
articles.description: Almost every web application requires some form of authentication. This prevents unauthorized users from having access to the app's inner workings.  In this tutorial, you will learn how to authenticate your React app with the Firebase SDK. How to Authenticate with Firebase Authenticating with Firebase makes things easy for
articles.title: How to Use Firebase Authentication in a React App

articles.author: Edan Ben-Atar
articles.description: SEO (Search Engine Optimization) is essential for your online marketing strategy. It's the process of optimizing your site and content to help you get as much traffic as you can from search engines. Reaching top positions in the search engine results pages (SERPs) with your website is one of the
articles.title: SEO Tips for Developers

articles.author: Logan Kilpatrick
articles.description: The Julia programming language is used for a lot of really impactful and interesting challenges like Machine Learning and Data Science.  But before you can get to the complex stuff, it is worth exploring the basics to develop a solid foundation.  In this tutorial, we will go over
articles.title: Learn Julia by Coding 7 Projects – Hands-On Programming Tutorial
